item.title: In Itself and Forever Shipwreck
item.description: A photograph is not a record of a thing itself                               but a record of a thing in a moment, as it won't be in the future. The photograph---the record---will accrue value in direct relation to the nature and extent of                                                     the changes that will be undergone by the thing photographed. Or even just the things around it.

item.title: Textual Encounters of the Worthwhile Kind
item.description: Reading without taking notes is as good as not reading. What was the last text you read, of any significant length or substance — book, chapter, article, or blog post? How long ago did you read it? How much of it has stayed with you? What do you remember more clearly: the text itself, the circumstances in which you read it, or the feeling of accomplishment that came over you as you finished it?
